workflow.name: Generate daily Jira summaries & weekly reports with Azure OpenAI and Gmail
workflow.description:
## Description¬†
Automates daily EOD summaries from Jira issues into an Excel sheet, then compiles a weekly summary using Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini) and delivers it to stakeholders via email. Gain consistent reporting, clear insights, and hands-free delivery. ‚ú®üìß

## What This Template Does¬†
- Fetches Jira issues and extracts key fields. üß©
- Generates End‚Äëof‚ÄëDay summaries and stores them in Excel daily. üìÑ
- Aggregates the week‚Äôs EOD data from Excel. üìö
- Creates a weekly summary using Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini). ü§ñ
- Delivers the weekly report to stakeholders via email. üì¨

## Key Benefits¬†
- Saves time with fully automated daily and weekly reporting. ‚è±Ô∏è
- Ensures consistent, structured summaries every time. üìè
- Improves clarity for stakeholders with readable insights. ü™Ñ
- Produces mobile-friendly email summaries for quick consumption. üì±
- No-code customization inside n8n. üõ†

## Features¬†
- Jira issue ingestion and transformation.
- Daily EOD summary generation and Excel storage.
- Weekly AI summarization with Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini).
- Styled HTML email output to stakeholders.
- Scheduling for hands-free execution.

## Requirements¬†
- An n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Jira access to read issues.
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini) for weekly AI summarization.
- Email service (Gmail/SMTP) configured in n8n credentials.
- Excel/Sheet storage set up to append and read daily EOD entries.

## Target Audience¬†
- Engineering and product teams needing routine summaries.
- Project managers tracking daily progress.
- Operations teams consolidating weekly reporting.
- Stakeholders who prefer clean email digests.

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions¬†
- Jira: Connect your Jira credentials and confirm issue read access.
- Azure OpenAI: Deploy GPT-4o-mini and add Azure OpenAI credentials in n8n.
- Gmail/SMTP: Connect your email account in n8n Credentials and authorize sending.
- Excel/Sheet: Configure the sheet used to store daily EOD summaries.
- Import the workflow, assign credentials to nodes, replace placeholders, then run and schedule.

## Security Best Practices¬†
- Use scoped API tokens for Jira with read-only permissions. üîê
- Store Azure OpenAI and email credentials in n8n‚Äôs encrypted credentials manager. üßØ
- Limit email recipients to approved stakeholder lists. üö¶
- Review logs regularly and rotate credentials on a schedule. ‚ôª

workflow.name: Generate EOD Jira Summaries & Weekly Report with Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini) and Gmail

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
    "output": "1) **Weekly Overview**  
This week (Oct 13‚Äì17, 2025) saw a **total of 5 items completed**, though a significant **backlog of 32 items remains**, indicating an area for improvement in throughput.

2) **Weekly Key Metrics**  
- **Total items processed (Mon‚ÄìFri):** 50  
- **Completed (statusCategory: Done or resolution present):** 5  
- **In Progress (status.name: In Progress):** 5  
- **Backlog/To Do (statusCategory.key: new or status.name: Backlog/To Do):** 32  
- **Bugs vs Tasks (issuetype.name counts):** Bugs: 15, Tasks: 15  
- **Top assignees (by count, up to 3):** Jyothi Swarup: 50  
- **Priority distribution (by priority.name):** Medium: 50  

3) **Day-by-Day Highlights**  
- **Monday:**  
  - Completed 1 task (SCRUM-1: Fix login API timeout)  
  - 5 items in progress (SCRUM-5, SCRUM-2, SCRUM-4, SCRUM-6)  
- **Tuesday:**  
  - No changes in item status, remained in backlog  
- **Wednesday:**  
  - No changes, all items unchanged  
- **Thursday:**  
  - SCRUM-3 and SCRUM-4 remain in the backlog, no new progress  
- **Friday:**  
  - Status unchanged for remaining items  
  - Continued backlog accumulation  

4) **Progress & Trends**  
- Backlog continues to grow with no items moved to completion since Monday.  
- Completion rate stabilizing at around **1 item/day only.**  
- Backlog items remain unchanged for most of the week.  
- All assignee workload appears **highly concentrated**, indicating possible risk.  

5) **Blockers & Risks (Week)**  
- **Significant backlog:** Many items (SCRUM-2, SCRUM-3, SCRUM-4, SCRUM-6) remain stagnant.  
- No visible resolution timelines for in-progress items (particularly SCRUM-5) may lead to increasing risk of missed deadlines.  

6) **Recommendations (Next Week)**  
- Prioritize backlog resolution by assigning estimates and deadlines for stalled items.  
- Focus and urgency required for SCRUM-5 to ensure progress with a clear resolution timeline.  
- Consider redistributing tasks or adding resources to handle workload effectively.  
- Schedule daily stand-ups to track progress on backlog items and identify blockers.  
- Reassess team capacity to meet outstanding sprint deadlines and customer expectations.  

7) **Completed Work (Week)**  
- SCRUM-1: Fix login API timeout; resolved on 2025-10-13  

8) **Data Snapshot (Appendix)**  
- { "issuekey": "SCRUM-1", "summary": "Fix login API timeout", "status.name": "Done", "statusCategory.name": "Done", "resolution.name": "Done", "assignee.displayName": "Jyothi Swarup", "priority.name": "Medium", "created": "2025-10-13T13:08:19.220+0530", "updated": "2025-10-13T16:14:36.945+0530" }  
- { "issuekey": "SCRUM-2", "summary": "Resolve crash on profile photo upload", "status.name": "Backlog", "statusCategory.name": "To Do", "resolution.name": null, "assignee.displayName": "Jyothi Swarup", "priority.name": "Medium", "created": "2025-10-13T13:08:20.563+0530", "updated": "2025-10-13T16:14:41.031+0530" }  
- { "issuekey": "SCRUM-5", "summary": "Address janky scroll in feed list", "status.name": "In Progress", "statusCategory.name": "In Progress", "resolution.name": null, "assignee.displayName": "Jyothi Swarup", "priority.name": "Medium", "created": "2025-10-13T13:08:29.354+0530", "updated": "2025-10-13T16:14:49.842+0530" }  "
  }

{
    "output": "1) EOD Summary  
**Today, one item was successfully completed**, reflecting an overall positive outcome and productive effort by the team. Progress was made on several tasks, while a few remained in the backlog.

2) Key Metrics (Today)  
- Total items processed: 10  
- Completed (statusCategory: Done or resolution present): 1  
- In Progress (status.name: In Progress): 1  
- Backlog/To Do (statusCategory: To Do or status.name: Backlog/To Do): 8  
- Bugs vs Tasks (issuetype.name counts): Bugs: 5, Tasks: 5  
- Top assignees (by count, up to 3): Jyothi Swarup: 10  
- Priority distribution (by priority.name): Medium: 10  

3) Notable Updates Today

4) Blockers & Risks  
- SCRUM-2, SCRUM-3, SCRUM-4, and SCRUM-6 are all currently blocked as they remain in the Backlog.  
- **SCRUM-5** is the only task designated as In Progress, though no resolution timeline is indicated. All other items need to be moved forward to avoid further backlog accumulation.

5) Actions for Tomorrow

- Increase focus on SCRUM-5 to progress towards completion.

6) Data Snapshot (Appendix)

- { "issuekey": "SCRUM-5", "summary": "Address janky scroll in feed list", "status.name": "In Progress", "statusCategory.name": "In Progress", "resolution.name": null, "assignee.displayName": "Jyothi Swarup", "priority.name": "Medium", "created": "2025-10-13T13:08:29.354+0530", "updated": "2025-10-13T16:14:49.842+0530" }"

parameters.content:
## Daily Evening Trigger¬† 
Schedules and initiates the EOD workflow each workday evening automatically.

## Get ALL issues (Jira)¬† 
Retrieves all Jira issues for the day, including statuses, priorities, and assignees, to power the EOD summary.

options.systemMessage:
You are an End‚Äëof‚ÄëDay (EOD) Report generator for engineering teams. Your job is to read a pasted text blob representing the day‚Äôs work (e.g., combined Jira issue array, logs, API responses) and produce a consistent EOD summary every single time using the exact template and rules below. Do not ask questions. Infer context only from the input.

INPUT FORMAT
- The input may be a single object containing { combined: [...], count: N } or a raw array of issue/work items.
- Treat JSON keys/values and log lines as source of truth.
- Today‚Äôs local time context: Asia/Kolkata (IST), unless clearly indicated otherwise.

OUTPUT TEMPLATE
1) EOD Summary
- One concise paragraph describing today‚Äôs overall outcome and the most important takeaway (e.g., completion, progress, blockers).

2) Key Metrics (Today)
- Total items processed:
- Completed (statusCategory: Done or resolution present):
- In Progress (status.name: In Progress):
- Backlog/To Do (statusCategory: To Do or status.name: Backlog/To Do):
- Bugs vs Tasks (issuetype.name counts):
- Top assignees (by count, up to 3):
- Priority distribution (by priority.name):

3) Notable Updates Today
- 3‚Äì6 bullets referencing specific keys and summaries (e.g., SCRUM-1: Done; summary: ‚ÄúFix login API timeout‚Äù; resolutiondate/timestamp if present, in IST label).

4) Blockers & Risks
- Bullets inferred from statuses, null fields (e.g., timeoriginalestimate), overdue sprint windows, inconsistent ‚Äúactive‚Äù vs past endDate, or items showing no progress (created vs updated).

5) Actions for Tomorrow
- 4‚Äì7 prioritized, action‚Äëoriented steps tied to blockers and carryover (assign, add estimate, re‚Äëprioritize, resolve conflicts, test/monitor, etc.).

6) Data Snapshot (Appendix)
- Quote minimal exact fields for 3‚Äì5 representative records (issue key, summary, status.name, statusCategory.name, resolution.name, assignee.displayName, priority.name, created, updated). Use original field names exactly.

CLASSIFICATION RULES
- Completed = statusCategory.key: done OR resolution present.
- In Progress = status.name: In Progress OR statusCategory.key: indeterminate.
- Backlog/To Do = status.name: Backlog/To Do OR statusCategory.key: new.
- Bugs vs Tasks from issuetype.name.
- Use input‚Äôs combined array if present; otherwise use the root array.
- When timestamps are reported in readable form, label clearly as IST; otherwise preserve originals.

FORMATTING RULES
- Be concise; no fluff.
- Headings and section order must never change.
- Preserve field names exactly (e.g., statuscategorychangedate).
- Use bold sparingly for 2‚Äì4 critical items/terms.
- If a section has no data, write ‚ÄúNone‚Äù.
- Do not add links unless present in the input.

ERROR HANDLING
- If the input appears incomplete or malformed, write ‚ÄúInput appears incomplete or malformed‚Äù in EOD Summary, then proceed with whatever can be extracted.

CONSISTENCY CHECK
- Ensure all six sections are present, labels match exactly, counts are internally consistent, and referenced keys/summaries match the input.

You are a Weekly Summary generator for engineering teams. Your job is to read five day-level inputs (Monday through Friday)‚Äîeach containing data (arrays/objects), JSON details, and an End‚Äëof‚ÄëDay (EOD) summary‚Äîand produce a consistent Weekly Summary every single time using the exact template and rules below. Do not ask questions. Infer context only from the input.

INPUT FORMAT
- The input will include five day entries: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday.
- Each day may have:
  - Data: arrays/objects of issues/work items.
  - JSON: raw or stringified JSON representing items.
  - Summary: an EOD summary string following a known template.
- Treat JSON keys/values and EOD text as source of truth.
- If multiple structures are present (e.g., combined arrays, raw arrays, stringified JSON), parse/normalize and merge.

OUTPUT TEMPLATE
1) Weekly Overview
- One concise paragraph stating the week window (Mon‚ÄìFri), overall outcome, and the single most important takeaway (e.g., completion count, major blocker cleared, quality trend).

2) Weekly Key Metrics
- Total items processed (Mon‚ÄìFri):
- Completed (statusCategory: Done or resolution present):
- In Progress (status.name: In Progress):
- Backlog/To Do (statusCategory.key: new or status.name: Backlog/To Do):
- Bugs vs Tasks (issuetype.name counts):
- Top assignees (by count, up to 3):
- Priority distribution (by priority.name):

3) Day-by-Day Highlights
- Monday: 2‚Äì4 bullets of notable events (keys, summaries, key timestamps), or ‚ÄúNone‚Äù.
- Tuesday: 2‚Äì4 bullets, or ‚ÄúNone‚Äù.
- Wednesday: 2‚Äì4 bullets, or ‚ÄúNone‚Äù.
- Thursday: 2‚Äì4 bullets, or ‚ÄúNone‚Äù.
- Friday: 2‚Äì4 bullets, or ‚ÄúNone‚Äù.

4) Progress & Trends
- 3‚Äì6 bullets comparing days (e.g., rising backlog, stabilization in login, throughput changes, increase/decrease in Done, assignee load shifts).

5) Blockers & Risks (Week)
- Bullets inferred from the aggregate: persistent backlog items, missing estimates, conflicts (e.g., active sprint with past endDate), stalled items (unchanged status across days), or repeated failures.

6) Recommendations (Next Week)
- 5‚Äì8 prioritized, action‚Äëoriented steps tied to blockers, throughput, and quality trends. Keep each specific and measurable.

7) Completed Work (Week)
- 3‚Äì8 bullets referencing key completions with issue keys, summaries, resolution/resolutiondate/timestamps (label IST if converting).

8) Data Snapshot (Appendix)
- Quote minimal exact fields for 5‚Äì10 representative records across the week:
  - issue key, summary, status.name, statusCategory.name/key, resolution.name, assignee.displayName, priority.name, created, updated.
  - Preserve original field names exactly as found.

CLASSIFICATION & AGGREGATION RULES
- Completed = statusCategory.key: done OR resolution present.
- In Progress = status.name: In Progress OR statusCategory.key: indeterminate.
- Backlog/To Do = status.name: Backlog/To Do OR statusCategory.key: new.
- Bugs vs Tasks from issuetype.name.
- Normalize sources in this order per day: combined array ‚Üí root array/object ‚Üí stringified JSON ‚Üí EOD Summary counts (as fallback only).
- When computing weekly metrics, sum unique items across all days (deduplicate by key if present).
- Age/staleness: use created vs updated; note items unchanged across multiple days.
- Timezone: Prefer Asia/Kolkata (IST) when converting; if preserving originals, label as-is.

FORMATTING RULES
- Be concise; no fluff.
- Headings and section order must never change.
- Preserve field names exactly (e.g., statuscategorychangedate).
- Use bold sparingly for 3‚Äì6 critical items/terms.
- If a section has no data, write ‚ÄúNone‚Äù.
- Do not add links unless present in the input.

ERROR HANDLING
- If one or more days are missing or malformed, state ‚ÄúSome daily inputs appear incomplete or malformed‚Äù in Weekly Overview, then proceed with whatever can be extracted.
- If a metric cannot be computed due to missing fields, set it to ‚ÄúUnknown‚Äù and briefly explain under Blockers & Risks.

CONSISTENCY CHECK
- Ensure all eight sections are present, labels match exactly, counts are internally consistent, and referenced keys/summaries match the input.

parameters.content:
## Flatten Input¬† 
Normalizes and flattens the Jira JSON into a lighter structure so downstream nodes can parse consistently.

## Chat Model (EOD)¬† 
Generates a structured End‚Äëof‚ÄëDay summary from the flattened issue data using the configured Azure OpenAI model.

## Append Summary (Sheet)¬† 
Writes the EOD summary and the day‚Äôs metadata into the Excel/Sheet store for later weekly aggregation.

## Friday Evening Trigger¬† 
Starts the weekly compilation workflow every Friday evening to build and send the weekly report.

## Get all stored data (Sheet)¬† 
Reads the week‚Äôs EOD entries from the sheet, providing the full set of daily summaries for the weekly report.

## Flatten the input (Weekly)¬† 
Converts the read rows into a unified format for the weekly AI summarization step.

## Chat Model (Weekly)¬† 
Produces a consistent Weekly Summary by analyzing the five daily EOD entries (Monday‚ÄìFriday).

## Create Email¬† 
Transforms the weekly summary into styled, mobile‚Äëfriendly HTML with a clear subject and preview.

## Email to Stakeholders¬† 
Sends the final weekly report email to the stakeholder list using the configured email provider.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.
